title: Best Student Paper Award at ITNG 2025
description: I attended the 2025 International Conference on Information Technology: New Generations (ITNG 2025) in Las Vegas, Nevada with my mentor (and friend) Stephen Wormald. I am extremely grateful to Dr. Anne Donnelly and the UF Center of Undergraduate Research for supporting me with a Travel Award to attend this event.
secondParagraph: Stephen and I presented a paper on leveraging Differentiable Logic Gate Networks for more explainable outputs and were honored to receive this year's Best Student Paper Award. We also had some time to explore the Valley of Fire and climb some mountains. Also grateful for Olivia and Reiner for the hospitality and for letting us crash at their place.

title: Hack Space Con
description: I received the ITIAS Hack Space Con Scholarship to attend this year's Hack Space Con and tour the Kennedy Space Center thanks to David Vozzola. I had a phenomenal time learning more about cybersecurity and attending talks related to machine learning. I am grateful for Dr. Woodard's recommendation and for Dr. Vozzola's support and hospitality.

title: Summa Cum Laude Honors Thesis
description: Successfully completed my honors thesis with Summa Cum Laude distinction, representing the highest level of academic achievement.

title: DSI Organization of the Year
description: Data Science and Informatics (DSI), the club I have served as the President of for the previous academic year, has won the award for Organization of the Year. I also nominated my friend and DSI's next external-vice president, My Pham, to the Emerging Gator Award which seeks to recognize underclassmen leaders - which she won!
secondParagraph: Some of the initiatives we have held in the past year include hosting a free 400-person Nvidia Deep Learning workshop in which participants received official certifications, supporting 54 students to compete at ShellHacks (Florida's largest hackathon) and organizing a day-long research symposium with over 20 speakers, 7 student research posters and 100+ attendees.

title: UF Hall of Fame Induction
description: I was honored to be inducted into the University of Florida Hall of Fame, the highest distinction a student leader can get at UF. Since 1921, the University of Florida selects 25 seniors or graduate students for this award based on leadership experiences, academic achievements, and service to the university community.
secondParagraph: My parents (4th slide picture) drove up to attend the ceremony and my other guests included Dr. Catia Silva, Dr. Domenic Forte and Dr. Elizabeth Johnson who have supported me every step along the way.

title: UF DataFest Best Visualization Award
description: My team and I won the Best Visualization Award at the 2025 UF ASA DataFest competition. This is the third year the event is hosted and also the third year I have competed.
secondParagraph: The event is akin to a hackathon but for data science. Over the span of 2 days, teams are given a dataset and are tasked with extracting insights from the data and pitching their findings with a 5 slide presentation to a panel of judges. Grateful for my friends Aaron, Adit, Ishan and Aadhi (who got sick and did not make the closing ceremony)for the company and for the opportunity to compete.

title: CLAS Excellence Award Finalist
description: I was nominated by Dr. Elizabeth Johnson and Dr. Demetris Athienitis in the Department of Statistics for this college-wide award. While I did not win the award, I was one of seventeen finalists!

title: UF Outstanding Leader Award
description: I was honored to be one of the 7 graduating seniors across the entire University of Florida to receive the Outstanding Leader Award. Every year the University of Florida selects a total of 14 graduating seniors, 7 for leadership excellence (Leaders Award) and 7 for academic excellence (Scholars Award). This was an incredible ceremony that took place right before the general University-wide graduation ceremony where I got to speak with UF President Kent Fuchs and Provost Joe Glover (as well as many other important people)
secondParagraph: I would like to share this award with all of the student organizations I have been a part of and the fellow student leaders I have worked with. I have been the president of Data Science and Informatics (DSI) for the past year, which recently won the award for Organization of the Year. Apart of DSI, I was the Vice President of UF's Statistics Club, Director of Campus Connections at UF's AI Club and co-founded UF's IEEE Signal Processing Society Chapter alongside my friend Raul Valle.

title: 2024 McKnight Annual Fellows Conference
description: I was honored to be invited to present a research poster at this year's McKnight Annual Fellows Conference.
secondParagraph: I was one of the few undergraduate students present at the conference, being invited due to being a FGLSAMP scholar at the University of FLorida. I presented my research work on MIRAGE, a software I developed during my summer at Carnegie Mellon University that enables users to compare the outputs of different text-to-image models.

title: UF Swamphacks X Best AI Award
description: Our team won the Best AI Award at UF Swamphacks X, the University of Florida's premier hackathon event, for developing an innovative artificial intelligence solution.

title: Hispanic Scholarship Fund Scholar
description: Selected as a Hispanic Scholarship Fund Scholar, recognizing academic achievement and leadership potential within the Hispanic community.

title: UF GenAI Arts Competition 2nd Place Overall
description: Achieved 2nd place overall in the University of Florida's Generative AI Arts Competition, showcasing creative applications of artificial intelligence technology.

title: UF AI Days Hackathon Most Popular Award
description: Won the Most Popular Award at UF AI Days Hackathon, where our project received the most votes from event participants and attendees.
